results.title: Full circle
results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This is a stirring documentary that awakens memories of ancestral roots that connect us to each other and to all living things. It is a journey that looks at some of the manifestations of the modern women’s spirituality movement in the western world. Through contmporary spirituality, whether from Wicca, pagan or indigenous peoples we see people communing with each other or alone. Rituals become gateways that lead to an inner place where twentieth century notions of domination over the earth are replaced with a sense of awe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Burning times
results.creator_credit: Donna Read, Signe Johansson, Margaret Pettigrew, Mary Armstrong and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This beautifully crafted documentary is an in-depth look at the witch persecutions that swept through Europe just a few hundred years ago. False accusations and trials led to extensive torture and burnings at the stake, and ultimatley to the destruction of a way of life that had endured for thousands of years. Of those killed, 85% were women and widespread violence against women, still prevalent today, can be traced back to those times. It investigates the role of the Catholic Church in the crimes and explores the process whereby the old pagan communities, founded on spirituality and cooperation, were transformed into the misogynist capitalist societies of our own century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donna Read, Signe Johansson, Margaret Pettigrew, Mary Armstrong and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Goddess remembered
results.creator_credit: Donna Read, Magaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This stunning and poetic documentary is a salute to 35,000 years of pre-history, to the solid values of ancestors only recently remembered, and to our ancient goddess-worshipping religions. Archaeologists and anthropologists are beginning to discover evidence of a widespread early civilisation based primarily on human co-operation. This epsiode reveals these forgotten cultures - taking us from ancient caves in France to the sun-drenched palaces at Delphi and Crete. There is also a discussion among well-known scholars such as Merlin Stone and Jean Bolen, who propose a return to a belief in an interconnected life system, with respect for the earth and the female.

group_works.title: Compliance, self control and prosocial behavior

results.title: Intellectual growth and achievement
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: enhancing social and cognitive growth in children.”.
Parents and teachers are ambitious for their children to become good students. Questions about how to develop intellectual growth and achievement have been the focus of many psychological studies. Examines myths such as predicting later ability on early achievement in childhood and the importance of hands on activity as opposed to observation. Factors determining IQ, using twins and adoptees raise interesting questions regarding the nature versus nurture debate, as well as looking at factors during pregnancy which may affect intellectual development.

group.title: Human development: enhancing social and cognitive growth in children.

group_siblings.title: Compliance, self control and prosocial behavior

results.title: Compliance, self control and prosocial behavior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: enhancing social and cognitive growth in children.”.
The socialisation process is important if children are to be raised into healthy adults. Skills and traits children must learn are co-operation, sharing, empathy, self-control, the delay of gratification and empathy which can be enhanced through play. Styles of parenting are discussed together with the technique of modeling to develop positive behaviour and the effect of self-fulfilling prophecies.

results.title: Emotional and social development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Discusses Erikson’s eight stages of development looking at the first two stages of trust versus mistrust and autonomy versus shame and doubt as applying to infants. A newborn baby moves through a development process to become a social being. Focuses on critical periods in development such as stranger anxiety, attachment, separation anxiety and preparation-individuation.

results.title: Language development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
This episode looks at how young infants acquire language. Chomsky’s theories about innate language competencies are examined as are the theories of operative conditioning and modelling where environment rather than herditary factors are seen to be more influential in the process of language acquisition. Babies use talking movements from birth and the program illustrates the processes whereby “babbling” becomes articulate speech.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Cognition involves the acquiring and use of knowledge. From birth, infants must learn how to learn and develop their senses, memory and perception. This episode discusses the stages of cognitive development as well as examining the theories of Piaget, the roles of recognition and receptive memory and the effect of stimulation in developing cognitive skills.
